channel.title: Method.invoke()
channel.description: I'm hearing all of you guys talking about avoiding invoke(), so I did a little research and the RS client uses java.lang.reflect.Method to do some shit of which I have no idea (trap?). Could someone explain this to me?

item.title: Method.invoke()
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:7, topic:7419”][quote author=White Castle link=topic=10369.msg115538#msg115538 date=1154511895]
Okay, so just calling a method more than the times it’s called in the regular client code = teh bans?
[/quote]

if you notice the:

anInt???++;

at the beginning of almost every method it should tip you off ;)[/quote]

I did in fact notice that… but they don’t lead anywhere? The client doesn’t send it to the server… or does it?

Read full topic

item.title: Method.invoke()
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:2, topic:7419”]yes, invoking the runescape client would interrupt the runescape loop by adding something in…
im not 100% sure how it works.

but on the runescape client side. they use reflection to return values of the classes to the server meaning if you add or change (rename) methods or variables in the client, i spose even add you will be breaking the “fresh” runescape client thus the client being detected.

i hope this is what you need[/quote]
ummm you can’t interrupt… Invoke() just calls a method in your current thread. It is about 10 times slower than direct calling it.[br][size=1]Posted at: August 02, 2006, 10:13:53 PM[/size][hr][quote=“moparisthebest, post:7, topic:7419”][quote author=White Castle link=topic=10369.msg115538#msg115538 date=1154511895]
Okay, so just calling a method more than the times it’s called in the regular client code = teh bans?
[/quote]

if you notice the:

anInt???++;

at the beginning of almost every method it should tip you off ;)[/quote]
way around this is use have your own set of their classes and use those for its methods.

Read full topic

Stop being a spamming noob Taios =P Renaming doesn’t instantly ban you

item.title: Method.invoke()
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“popcorn89, post:4, topic:7419”][quote author=White Castle link=topic=10369.msg115538#msg115538 date=1154511895]
Okay, so just calling a method more than the times it’s called in the regular client code = teh bans?
[/quote]Supposedly editing a method in any way (including renaming) will get you banned, but that’s just not true…[/quote]

You need to be obtain 50 rep and be a community member, then you would see a trap that Krichevskoy found. <3

Read full topic

item.title: Method.invoke()
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

yes, invoking the runescape client would interrupt the runescape loop by adding something in…
im not 100% sure how it works.

but on the runescape client side. they use reflection to return values of the classes to the server meaning if you add or change (rename) methods or variables in the client, i spose even add you will be breaking the “fresh” runescape client thus the client being detected.

i hope this is what you need

Read full topic
